Apple Nachos - 1 serving
Ingredients:
• 1 Apple (Cut into thin slices)
• ¼ cup Smooth Peanut Butter
• 2 Tbs. Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips
Directions:
1. Carefully slice apple and arrange on a plate.
2. Melt the peanut butter in a small microwave safe bowl for 20 seconds. Mix and microwave at 10 second intervals until melted.
3. Drizzle the melted peanut butter on the apple slices.
4. Sprinkle the chocolate chips on top of your apple slices.
5. Eat and enjoy!!
Fun Tips:
• Substitute your favorite nut butter if you’re not a fan of peanut butter. Almond butter is also delicious.
• Top your nachos with other yummy toppings such as: Granola, Nuts, Shredded Coconut, Pomegranate Seeds, Raisins, or Caramel Sauce.

post_text: Bridgehampton eleventh and twelfth grade students attended a full-day poetry writing workshop at the Watermill Center recently. The third annual event was led by English teacher Mr. Tom House. The students toured the Center and listened to an introduction of its history and programs before selecting one of hundreds of fascinating objects from around the world in the Center’s archives room to write ekphrastic poems – poems that take art or objects as their subject or inspiration. Students shared their impressive work at the end of the day in an enlightening and lively round-circle slam. The Bridgehampton School is grateful to the Watermill Center for continuing to host this exciting program as well as to Mr. House and art teacher Ms. Robin Gianis who served as a chaperone on the visit.

post_text: The Bridgehampton School District hosted a parent/staff/student/volunteer kick-off dinner to start the Robotics Club competitive season and to honor two community volunteers who have been instrumental in the success of the robotics program - Julie Burmeister and Jonathan Fletcher. The two were honored for their countless volunteer hours on weeknights and weekends to mentor Bridgehampton students. The district congratulates all the students involved in the Robotics Club and advisers Ms. Judiann Carmack-Fayyaz and Mr. Luke Ferland as well mentor Mr. Kenneth Giosi. The team will compete in 2020 in the FIRST Robotics International competition in Orlando as well as the at the FIRST Robotics national competition at Hofstra University. Congratulations to all!

post_text: The Bridgehampton School District has introduced a Construction Student Ambassador Program where students have an opportunity to meet with the architect, construction manager and constructors who are involved in the 35,000-square-foot expansion of the school building, which includes a new gymnasium, cafeteria, fitness center, locker rooms and a technology room. The real-world experience, which takes place every two weeks, allows students to ask questions and tour the construction site. “This opportunity enables our students to develop a wide range of skills from communication, collaboration, responsibility, confidence and leadership,” Superintendent of Schools Robert Hauser said. “We are pleased that they can master these abilities right outside our school building.”
